title: Email sender's name is incorrect
content:
In one of my six email accounts all of a sudden 16 emails are all showing the same, but incorrect name of the sender. This is happening only on my laptop, not my desktop. In as much as they all involve an on-going real estate transaction, this is somewhat frustrating. The name shown, is actually one I correspond with in a totally different context. I've tried Repair Folder and Compact Folder as well as update, restart, etc. To clarify, the sender's address goes from <REALNAME@Correctaddress> to <INCORRECTNAME @ Correctaddress> I've checked the Address Book and it appears that the INCORRECTNAME has taken over the REALNAME. How do I correct this and prevent it from happening again, and how might it have happened?

Thanks for your help.
creator: rcaastro

content:

title: Thunderbird Export/Import loses all personal e-mail folders
content:
Thunderbird 115 was so bad that I exported my profile to a Thunderbird_profile_backup.zip on my Windows-11 laptop. I restored to Thunderbird 102.15.1. I had to re-create my profile before it would let me import my profile -- this should be fixed !!! Once I restored my profile, all of my personal e-mail folders were gone. The Export said it would also export my e-mails, but this didn't happen -- or at least the Import didn't restore them. Thunderbird 102.15.1 should be fixed to restore everything.

By the way, my e-mails were originally in a folder that I specified, not in the default folder.

Much appreciate any ideas.

title: Double Deletes and "Bouncy" Folder Contents Listing?
content:
Thanks for Thunderbird! I have contributed financially in the past but our current life situation precludes us from financial and logistical support right now. Hopefully things will eventually resolve, sooner rather than later.

Two concerns with fully updated Thunderbird SUPERNOVA (not present in versions before 115): 1) Clicking on the Delete Icon often times deletes two messages in rapid succession such that it is not detected unless I am very careful to watch the Folder Contents Listing during the delete operation. 2) The display of the Folder Contents Window "bounces" around randomly when deleting an incoming message. And most troubling, the focused element moves off of the viewable section.

Thanks in advance for keeping Thunderbird my de facto standard for email handling!

Keith L.

title: Almost all emails have disappeared from protonmail Inbox
content:
I use Thunderbird which has recently updated to 115.3.1 on Windows 10. After the update it was running correctly but suddenly all emails disappeared from all folder in one email account (Protonmail) except for the last 14 messages in the inbox. My two other email accounts are fine and all three accounts are fine on Thunderbird on my laptop and the emails are all available via the web interface to my account.

I have searched for similar problems and have tried all the advice I could find (checking folders are subscribed, checking All folders and All threads are checked, nothing in the serach or filter, repair folder etc.) and cannot recover the emails. It seems that somehow Thunderbird will not download the old emails from he IMAP server. As a last resort I deleted the account and then reinstalled it but I still only have Inbox with the 14 most recent messages.

Is there a database somewhere in the profile that I need to remove to allow Thuderbird to rebuild it?

Thanks for any help.
creator: a.g.parker

title: Thunderbird Email Client 115.3.1
content:
Is it possible any longer to configure Thunderbird 115.0 to open the address book in a separate window. Meaning stand alone? Address book by itself

It used to work using this method:

Navigate to the Mozilla Thunderbird folder on your computer. The default installation folder under Windows is C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\

Right-click the thunderbird.exe file and select Create Shortcut. Save it in that directory or alternatively on the desktop if restrictions prevent the saving to the same directory.

Right-click the shortcut afterwards and select Properties from the context menu. Locate the Target path in the Shortcut tab and add -addressbook at the end of it (there is a blank between the closing " and the -addressbook, the end should read thunderbird.exe -addressbook).

It brings up the Thunderbird, and puts the address book a tab. I want the address book to open stand "alone"

https://tinyurl.com/2daxwwnd

title: Se pierden filas oauth de la tabla de contraseñas para las cuentas de Microsoft.
content:
Hola qué tal.

Tengo el Thunderbird con varias cuentas (de google, microsoft y alguna más), y para las de Microsoft, desde que se actualizó a la versión 115 me pide con frecuencia la contraseña de modo "oauth".

He comprobado que, para cualquiera de Microsoft, la correspondiente fila oauth en la tabla de "Contraseñas guardadas" se había borrado. Con las cuentas de google y de otro proveedor que tengo no ocurre eso, no se borran.

He borrado las filas de imap para las cuentas de Microsoft pero no se soluciona. También he creado de nuevo las cuentas de Microsoft aceptando solamente la autenticación oauth (la imap la cancelo) pero tampoco se soluciona.

Estaré muy agradecido a cualquier tipo de ayuda que me deis.

Un saludo cordial, Pedro.

creator: margochester

title: Is Mozilla interested in micro payments
content:
I am attempting to develop a system of micro payments. I have been programming for over 20 years so, yeah! I do have a clue as to at least some of the problems, issues, complexity etc. On the other hand I am a sole developer trying to do this so clearly I am completely insane. Sorry for the jokes.

So micro-payments. Perhaps the largest problem with the internet is that there is no business model that works very well for the kind of market that is the internet. The internet is a *very-high-volume*, *very-low-cost* market. Some open source repositories have *millions* of downloads a week, but the maintainers make no money from them. Why? Because there is no economically feasible way for 1 million people to pay $0.0001.

We all suffer from clickbait because it is the only thing that comes close. You don't have users pay, you have advertisers pay because you track people and can target them. At this point we may be starting to realize exactly how damaging this targeting can be. To quote twitter code "if isDemocrat show DemocratFiles, elseif Republican show RepublicanFiles."

So what to do? Come up with a way so that open source maintainers can charge $0.01 (USD) for downloading a copy of a library. Or perhaps even less. There are many issues with making this work and I would be happy to discuss my thinking. Probably the largest issue is that any micro-payment system would need to be tied to a sticky identity. Like a phone number. This should raise alarm bells about privacy, but what if the sticky identity server just passed out random ids? AFf9fdazfsdaf talks to 9fzf8834489faa, for example.

Okay sticky ids now come present anonymous identities and so anonymous miscreants can now ride into town, rob the bank and run off. Except if you have a stick ID, what about attaching a reputation to that ID?

As you can tell this whole think gets pretty complicated pretty fast. On the other hand we have the openid, login with apple, login with google kind of stuff that demonstrates that the technology works. The way it is used is a problem, but login with Apple lets sites get sort of sticky IDs and tied to phones. Just not all phones.

On a practical note, I am trying to build a community newspaper that uses micro payments. So people can buy a copy of the newspaper online for $0.10 USD. That is my target use case for micro payments and sticky ID's.

But it sure would be nice to have some other eyes and some other use cases, for example what about a micro-payment based kick starter program to build new features in firefox or thunderbird? Etc.

So if you have anyone or know of anyone I would be very glad to talk.

I read something at Y-combinator once about the what makes Silicon Valley different from many places. They said when someone there heard a new idea, the reaction was

"If this did work what would that be like?"

So if micro payments were available, what would that be like for Mozilla?

Thanks Terry Braun tab@tabraun.com
creator: tab43
